benchmark_details.name: MMLA (Multimodal Language Analysis)
benchmark_details.overview: MMLA is a comprehensive benchmark designed for multimodal language analysis, covering six core dimensions (intent, emotion, dialogue act, sentiment, speaking style, and communication behavior) with over 61K multimodal utterances.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate foundation models in multimodal language analysis and highlight challenges and insights for future research.

data.source: Collected from nine publicly available multimodal language datasets.
data.size: 61,016 multimodal utterances totaling 76.6 hours of video

methodology.calculation: Accuracy and other metrics are calculated based on the predictions against ground truth labels in the dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and F1 scores indicate better model performance in recognizing and understanding multimodal utterances.
methodology.baseline_results: The best models achieved accuracies of below 70% on various tasks, post tuning improvements were noted.
methodology.validation: Dataset quality assurance through expert annotation and majority voting

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data is released under respective licenses and strictly for academic research purposes.
